com.milk.command
Class BaseCommand

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--com.milk.command.BaseCommand
All Implemented Interfaces:
Command
Direct Known Subclasses:
ChannelCommands.MyCommand, ChannelHolderCommands.MyCommand, IdentityCommands.MyCommand, LocusCommands.MyCommand, SystemCommands.MyCommand
public abstract class BaseCommand
extends java.lang.Object
implements Command

This is a base class which implements most of the standard Command functionality. It notably lacks public makeArgument() and protected commandRun(), which must be overridden to do reasonable things.

Author:
Dan Bornstein, danfuzz@milk.com
, Copyright 1999 Dan Bornstein, all rights reserved.

Constructor Detail

BaseCommand

public BaseCommand()
Construct a BaseCommand. It initially has an empty label and description, and is disabled.

run

public java.lang.Object run(java.lang.Object argument)
                     throws DisabledCommandException
Run the command with the given argument. The argument should be an object that was previously returned from makeArgument.

Specified by:
run in interface Command
Parameters:
argument - the argument of the command
Returns:
null-ok; the return value of running the command
Throws:
DisabledCommandException - thrown if the command is not enabled at the time this method is called

commandRun

protected abstract java.lang.Object commandRun(java.lang.Object argument)
Really run this command. BaseCommand.run() calls this, after checking to make sure the command is enabled. That is, this method is only ever called on an enabled command. Note that synchronization in this class ensures that only one thread at a time is in a particular object's commandRun() method.

Parameters:
argument - the argument of the command
Returns:
null-ok; the return value of running the command

setLabel

protected final void setLabel(java.lang.String label)
Set the label of this command. If it is in fact different from the old label, then a labelChanged event is sent to all appropriate listeners.

Parameters:
label - null-ok; the new label

setDescription

protected final void setDescription(java.lang.String description)
Set the description of this command. If it is in fact different from the old description, then a descriptionChanged event is sent to all appropriate listeners.

Parameters:
description - null-ok; the new description

setEnabled

protected final void setEnabled(boolean enabled)
Set the enabled state of this command. If it is in fact different from the old state, then an enabledChanged event is sent to all appropriate listeners.

Parameters:
enabled - the new enabled state

broadcast

protected final void broadcast(BaseEvent event)
Broadcast an event to all the listeners of this object.

Parameters:
event - the event to broadcast
